fredr
  • Reference

Set the FRED API key

Users fredr package must authenticate with the FRED API by use of an API key. The function fredr_key sets the FRED API key for use with the service. The key is cached in an .Renviron in the current working directory. The function gives a message and invisibly returns the key when it is already set. See Details section for more information.

fredr_key(api_key)

Arguments

api_key

A FRED API key as a string. Obtain one at https://api.stlouisfed.org/api_key.html.

Value

invisibly returns the value of the set API key as a string.

Details

fredr_key determines if the environment variable FRED_API_KEY is set. If it is, fredr_key() gives a message and invisibly returns the key. If FRED_API_KEY is not set, writes api_key to the file .Renviron, if it does not exist. If .Renviron exists in the directory, fredr_key throws an error. In this case, it is advised to manually add an entry FRED_API_KEY=api_key to .Renviron and restart the session. Once FRED_API_KEY has been properly set as an environment variable in .Renviron, you can use fredr in subsequent sessions without calling fredr_key each time.

References

See St. Louis Fed Web Services API Keys to obtain an API key.

See also

Note that by using a FRED API key, you agree to the FRED API Terms of Use.

Examples



# NOT RUN {
library(fredr)
fredr_key("abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz123456")
key <- fredr_key()
identical(key, "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz123456")
# }
